utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: This is a Fox News alert. I'm Jesse Watters and welcome to "The Five" on this very busy news day. We'll bring it all to you throughout the hour. We'll begin tonight with President Trump's headline making sit-down interview with Fox News' Jeanine Pirro. So, Jeanine talked with Mr. Trump about his decision to fire James Comey, whether the Democrats will ever cooperate with him. And here's what he said his threat to cancel the daily White House press briefing. Roll the tape.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: When we have those press conferences, I actually say, we shouldn't have them. Because Sarah Huckabee --

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: A hundred years we have been doing --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No but listen. There's never been action like this. This is crazy. I mean, they are getting higher ratings on those press conferences.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Would you seriously consider stopping these press sessions?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No. We do it in a different way. We do through a piece of paper with a perfectly accurate beautiful answer. I'll give you an example.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: In writing?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: They're asked a hundred questions, or 50 questions, or 20 questions, if they get one out of 50 just a little bit off, five percent, ten percent, 20 percent, next day it's a front page story in every newspaper.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Right. Right. So?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Now, press conferences weren't even covered for Obama practically, they were on C-span and C-Span 2 when, you know, there was nothing going on.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But will you put an end to that?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Just a minute. These press conferences are like the biggest thing on day time television.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They are.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Okay. You see the ratings.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: They are blowing everything on just about I think everything on day time television. What I would love to do is stop them.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, you know what I love about this, he's still bragging about the ratings.

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, he's right. I mean, it's the new "bold and the beautiful."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Day time television.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, really, they are kind of riveting.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes. I would call it general inhospitable.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And so, I think that he's serious when he's saying this that he's considering it and thinking about it. Because I remember before he even, you know, took office, and was sworn in, they were talking about that. And they were going to shake up the way that the press briefings were handled. The calms for his administration. And obviously, there is room for improvement in terms of the rollout, and when they need to get ahead of the messaging like we saw in the travel ban and like we saw here with the dismissal of Comey. So, perhaps it's not a bad idea that they do accompany it with, you know, a paper readout, electronic briefing, and then for some of the larger news days then they have somebody, their spokesman at the podium.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think Greg this is Donald Trump saying you guys are being so nasty to me, you know what I'm going to do? I am going to take away your toys for a little while. You can't play with them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what President Trump does, and people in the media forget, he likes to introduce options that were never introduced before.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because it's like why not, no one has ever said I can't do this. So, let's just see what happens. It's like, he likes to toss a stone into the pond and watch it ripple. But the person who doesn't take Donald Trump's word seriously most is Donald Trump. Words are free. It's like steam coming off an engine. He can talk a squirrel up a nut truck. And so his words are free and they flow. And if he changes his mind, he changes his mind. He doesn't take this stuff as seriously as other people do because he's from Queens, he's from Queens, he's a salesman, he's a salesman from Queens.

utterances.speaker: GILLIAN TURNER, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: My mom is from Queens.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love Queens.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Just saying.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's what you say about Queens. Gillian, is this really going to happen? Or is this just a vale of treat because, you know, Greg is just saying he's just talking or does Donald Trump himself need to start doing more press conferences? Because when he does it, that really moves the needle.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: I bet this is another one of his tactic, where one of his famous negotiating tactics, where he throws something extreme on the table, so that everybody can get worked out into a huff. And then what actually is going to play out is something much more moderate. So, I bet he's seriously mauling something over like, maybe we're not going to do them every day, maybe we're going to do them three days a week, maybe they're going to be shorter. Maybe we are not going to televise all of them. Something like that is under probably consideration. But I think that he might -- he's throwing this out so that when he actually settles on something, it's not so egregious to people, it is not so over the top.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, he's done this with everything.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Create an extreme position and then everything else seems moderate.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is right. And we should actually maybe ask him if he can do the pressers at 9:00.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe we could just take those live. Bob would love that. Wouldn't you, Bob?

utterances.speaker: BOB BECKEL, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I sure would. Yes. Now, listen. You know, you don't know how much I love Donald Trump. But I want to give a little credit here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Because he finally realizes that he is so disorganized, that nobody can keep up with him. And you put somebody out there with Sean Spicer, who I think now is a good sailor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Come on! You should talk.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You of all people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Did you just say that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, you actually look sharp tonight.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, thank you. Thank you, Jesse. Nice of you, son. But I think, frankly, it's not a bad idea because they can't keep on the same page. Because they change course in the day. You are right about his thinking, he doesn't -- well, he thinks, but -- no, no. He just keeps going. I mean, he doesn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's a shark. He's instinctual. Like, you know what I said yesterday is that, he's a shark who's unaware of the affects he has to the beach. He's just constantly moving and everybody on the beach is screaming. He is like, what did I do? I fired Comey.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: They evacuated the water. Everybody is gone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: These press conferences aren't on C-Span 2.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Right. Like President Obama's. I wonder why they were so worried because no one was asking --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: A comedy series and Trump and some historical thing on the British TV.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Something else that happened today was that Spicer was trying to respond to criticism about this. Well, he's going to get rid of the press briefing. And he said, we don't -- it's hard to coordinate on messaging. We don't always get to the President on every issue before we go out and talk to the press. And that was either a major cry for help or it was him admitting that he's not actually --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: He made the point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's see if President Trump addressed it with Judge Jeanine. Here's another little sneak peek.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Are moving so quickly that your Communications Department cannot keep up with you?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So what do we do about that?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We don't have press conferences and we do --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You don't mean that.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We just don't have them. Unless I have them every two weeks and I do it myself. We don't have them. I think it's a good idea. First of all, you have a level of hostility that's incredible. And it's very unfair. Sarah Huckabee is a lovely young woman. You know Sean Spicer. He is a wonderful human being. He's a nice man.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Is he your press secretary today and tomorrow? Is he really be tomorrow?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, he's doing a good job, but he gets beat up.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Will he be there tomorrow?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, he's been there from the beginning.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, what do you think about the President's assessment of his communications team?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think that there's a disconnect. You know, he has been there from the beginning. But if you want to be successful and do communications with President Trump, you have to be someone that he actually wants to spend a little bit of time with. You have got to insist on being able to get in front of Potus, talk to him and have like five, six minutes with him before you go out there and you take the podium, otherwise you are driving blind.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are they not getting that a lone time that they need?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you hear Sean Spicer saying, and the President is very busy. He's constantly on the go. So, it has to be something with a very close relationship where there is trust there, there's inherent loyalty, somebody that he knows that's been with him from the beginning, et cetera. I think that's very important.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is his job, the chief of staff, is he supposed to be the one that's controlling these meetings where they can get in front of each other before they go out?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, yes, that is his job. He's supposed to be the conduit to make sure that they are communicating, that they get face time together, that the messaging is on point, that everybody is on the same page. Otherwise, you get this one person saying another thing, the President is tweeting something else. You've got to be connected.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Can I make one point here?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: That the White House wanted to have our own Kimberly Guilfoyle as press secretary, and she decided she didn't want to do it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can't break up with Bob.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. That is right. Too much time away from each other. But I think that was a smart idea. I mean, but you are right, I do not know a press secretary that's been successful who has not had direct access to the President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But can I, there's something else that, we are sitting and ragging on the communications team. That's not the issue. The issue is this is a different kind of president. And we all know this because we are talking about this guy every single day. He is doing not one thing a day. He's usually doing four or five things a day. I compared into like a -- instructor or a cyclist who's -- the class can't keep up. He is always working everybody with the bone, so people can't keep up with him, including his own staff. His staff can't keep up with him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, you're saying the President has ADD and he's calling meetings and he's doing this and he's doing that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't say ADD. I'd say because he doesn't sleep, he doesn't drink, so he never has a hangover. Hangovers generally keep everybody in D.C. from doing anything before 11:00.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Listen, I wasn't drunk for 30 years, and I never saw noon. That was exactly right.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: In a certain extent, I disagree with you. Don't strike me again.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Don't worry. Don't worry about it. He's too small to hurt you.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: The idea that Trump now, he has got more on his plate, more on the agenda than other presidents that have come before, to me that doesn't cut the mustard. I don't buy that for a second. I think that the problem here is somebody, I don't know if it's the chief of staff, if it's Reince, someone is not exerting that discipline on this. Somebody is not convening the right people at the right times of day with the President and saying, look, this is the message, this is the message of the day, go forth. Here's what the President thinks. Someone is not doing that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Get a man into the Oval.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is right. It's the Oval.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: You do. That's exactly what has to happen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know what that means.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Want to find out?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: There's also, it's a small White House.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hold on. Go ahead, Bob.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: What you need to say to Trump is, are you going to have any surprises for us today? And you know, the thing is, they will have their press conference, and then he will do something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You know? And it totally, nobody knows anything about it. How do you communicate that?

utterances.speaker: WATTES
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: The only person who communicated I think Greg is right is Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Himself. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. He should be his own press.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, he is the best messenger. He knows exactly what he's thinking, what he's feeling, how he wants to say it. So, unless --

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: And he is the best --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Does he had a press conference?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Of course he has, Bob. But let's remain with the last press conference he had. He was on the ropes with the Russia thing a couple of months ago. And he came out and just rustled dazzled everybody and said you are very fake news, he put everybody in a locker and then he jetted off into the big rally. If he did that more and explained his positions to the American people, I think he would be a lot more effective, don't you agree?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Because if there's any position he decides to give to the American people is absolutely a good one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Couldn't be worse than anything Obama did.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Oh. Well, hey we go. Let's fault back to our defense, son. Right Back to Obama because we get in the corner, we can't defend Trump. We go back to --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm not in the corner at all, I'm right at the center of the table. Greg, let me ask you a question.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: A lot of this now, this story has become about process, about the communications can't keep up with the President and the story keeps changing. I think everybody is forgetting about the fact that he cut loose, Comey. Because he was ineffective. And he didn't feel like he had the trust and the credibility that he needed to do the job. That's the point of the story. It's not about Russia or the White House people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, Comey was essentially the Jan Brady of the FBI. He was in the middle of everything. But not making anything better. You know, Jan Brady ever showed up in every scene, it's just no one has seen. They had to get rid of Jan and find a Marcia. And right now it's about finding a Marcia. And I think it would be great if it were a woman.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You know, Huckabee said the vast majority of agents have come to them and said how terrible he was. And that is exactly a lie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which Huckabee?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Which Huckabee?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I can't distinguish between the two of them. By the way, the reason that you're in the middle is we always put the youngest guy in the middle.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I know. Bob, I'm going to try and save you just a little bit. All right. Judge Jeanine also asked President Trump about his controversial firing of FBI Director James Comey including a report from The New York Times that the President asked Comey for a loyalty pledge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: People suggests that the question that apparently The New York Times is selling that you asked Comey whether or not you had his loyalty was possibly inappropriate. Could you see how they think that?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No, I read that article. I don't think it's inappropriate. Number one.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Did you ask that question?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No, I didn't. But I don't think it would be a bad question is. I think loyalty to the country, loyalty to the United States is important. You know, I mean, it depends on how you define loyalty. Number one. Number two, I don't know how that got there. Because I didn't ask that question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What about the idea that in a tweet you said that there might be tape recordings?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Well, we can't talk about that. I won't talk about that. All I want is for Comey to be honest. And I hope he will be. And I'm sure he will be, I hope.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay, Jesse, what do you make of this? The report of the allegation is that the President was requesting or hoping for a loyalty pledge from the director?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, I don't know if I believe the New York Times anymore because they can't trust it. The only people that know what happened are James Comey and President Trump. And there's a lot of leaking going on. But The New York Times said this happened, and who knows because just the other day The New York Times said Comey asked for more resources for the Russia investigation before he was fired and that was fake news.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: That's your sole source for news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, not really, Bob.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: But now unless there's the recordings.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A lot of different notes. Excuse me?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Unless there is now there the recordings, you know, that the President mentioned.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't believe there are tapes. I believe he just said that to mess with people's heads and it's working, as you can see over here.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: It's great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So he's having people chase squirrels. And, you know, I don't think there is any tapes. And if there were, then that's trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Let me play this up, Greg and I will get you to respond. Because the President spoke with Sean Spicer field an avalanche of questions at today's press briefing. Take a listen to this exchange in particular.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Did President Trump record his conversations with former FBI Director Comey?

utterances.speaker: SEAN SPICER, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: I assume you are referring to the tweet. And I've talked to the President. The President has nothing further to add on that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why did he say that? Why did he tweet that? What should we interpret from that?

utterances.speaker: SPICER
utterances.utterance: As I mentioned, the President has nothing further to add on that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg. Two things. What about the tweeting that Donald Trump does?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to realize that that is much like what we do when we are driving, and somebody cuts us off. We rolled out on the window and we shout, hey you! And then five minutes later, you forget about it and you move on. That's what these tweets are. The other thing about loyalty, when he's talking about loyalty, the thing that concerns me about Trump, is that true loyalty is somebody who is honest to you and risking their own friendship to be honest. The hyper-critical is the person who cares. What I was worried about with President Trump, was that, he would surround himself with yes men and toadies. Because you seemed to be when you're an authoritarian type, you attract toadies and yes men.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You are exactly right too, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think but I think there's an even number of --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't see that though. I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think there are people that will talk to him.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Really? But he may not be listening.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. President Obama surrounded himself with yes men. There was no diversity in opinion within his cabinet --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: His wife would challenge him all the time.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: -- difficult here for the Trump because they're in different cities.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Gillian?

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: I disagree, Jesse. There have been entire books written about how there was differences of opinion among President Obama's cabinet when they decided everything, especially in foreign policy, which is mostly what I care about. You know, remember --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Look what happened to foreign policy with President Obama. No, my point is that Trump hired Reince Priebus who was I guess against him when he was the RNC chair until he came around. Tillerson came out of nowhere. McMaster, not necessarily a pro-Trump guy.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Most people were Trump guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think, I know, and now look at this.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Those are the two adults in the cabinet --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ben Carson, he ran against Ben Carson.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: By the way, have we heard anything from the Housing Secretary Ben Carson?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What would you like to hear?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I don't want to hear anything because I can't understand it. Now, I actually had a section eight house.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It wasn't a section eight house, it was a different kind of house.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Once in a while --

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: And Bob, there's three adults that called the access of adults just in case you're wondering.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: General Mattis, Secretary Tillerson and General McMaster. I think you are exactly right. And we leave out of that, the President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: But even, I mean, like Chris is not there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Christie was one of the original.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Don't you wonder though if we are not missing like the big picture here? To me the big picture is like, so the back story and fights about that is kind of backfiring on everybody. But to me the biggest problematic in terms of optics is the fact that now we're -- this administration is a hundred days in and we have a fired acting Attorney General, fired National Security adviser and a fired director of the FBI, all cabinet ranked positions that people tend to hold for years and rarely get fired from. I think this is what the Trump administration needs to finesse. Not who said what when and we have tapes, and we don't have tapes, I think we need to come up with a narrative --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Your point about foreign policy, in this administration there are huge issues going on in the Middle East for example. And all we have had is one trip by Jared in his -- with a bullet-proof vest on. I mean, the fact of the matter is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The President is going overseas next week.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, that's great. That's just wonderful. The President of the United States has to spend a lot of time getting for example, Australia who happens to be good ally of ours. Remember he hung up on the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. But that's fake news.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's fake news. Oh, Breitbart tell you this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He also said that Australia had the best healthcare ever. Because as a salesman, he says things to break the ice. Can we just talk -- yes, but I -- what I was going to say, I want to talk about the tweet. People are accusing him of being out of control and all this stuff. But nothing is deceptive when it's out in the open. We need tweets, for example, about, you know, recordings. I mean, if you were going to make a threat or you were going to tape something, you're going to do it secretive, he does everything, this is the most transparent president you have ever seen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. So, complain about it Bob.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Right. If it's transparent, then say whether there are tapes or not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think he hoped there were tapes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: But also when Jared went to Iraq, just for the record, he went with Secretary Tillerson. It was his delegation. He's not going --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He had a baby-sitter.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: He had a baby sitter.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Quite a bit of traveling.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: With one of our people, we got that. And I wasn't talking about you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What? I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know what that means.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The real winner, Bob, can we agree, is Putin because he's undermining our system by having us constantly worry about Russia when we should be looking at other matters.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I didn't get bet in.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The President touched on a number of other topics and his interview with Judge Jeanine like Democratic obstruction particularly from the Senate Minority Leader.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Will you be able to work with Schumer after all the horrible things he said about you?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: It's pretty tough to work with him. I am surprised because I have known him for a long time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Again, he's gone very, very far left. He doesn't have good control of his party, he's not a good leader. And I think it's going to be pretty tough for me to work with him. We'll see. Hopefully what will happen is in `18, we'll going to elect some Republican senators, because we only have a margin of two. We'll going to elect some people, some more Republicans and we will be able to do it without having to go through that situation with Schumer. Because honestly, they just want to stop things, they want to clog up the wheels. And we can't let that happen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. Jesse, you can imagine the President is pretty frustrated given everything that's been going on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, he came into office assuming he would have a good relationship with crying Chuck, and the relationship is really deteriorated once crying Chuck stabbed him at the back after they had a nice meeting. It doesn't surprise me that crying Chuck is acting like this because he needs to raise money for the Democrats in the Senate re-election committee because they are defending so many seats in the midterms. They are in deep, deep trouble in the midterms. I think ten of the states that they have to defend are Trump states. So, right now politically there is not a lot of reason for the Democrats in the Senate to go along with the President. But you can work with any president, it's this president if you are a Democrat. He's not an ideologue. He wants to get things done that everybody likes on both sides of the aisle.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Everybody like?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Infrastructure, trade, jobs.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think there is a lot of ways people can work together in Washington.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Listen, you know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The Lefts would come to the table.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You want to say crying Chuck one more time?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Crying Chuck.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. Okay. The fact of the matter is, the reason the Democrats have done that, you know, Obama got no Republican votes on those major bills he puts through. None!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because they were so far left.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, really. And the reason that Trump --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Republicans didn't want -- is that a big surprise?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Democrats should not going to vote for this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Republicans who didn't want to own the death spiral. Sorry. I mean, that's not --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: The death spiral is here, it's landed. And it's in the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's just pulled out of every exchange. So, that's what you called a --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's --

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Well, the laws of unintended consequences this week I think was in full force on this issue, we saw the way that this has, the firing of Jim Comey has created this like ground swell of Democratic support.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: All these people like Chuck Schumer have jumped ship. Like Dick Durbin and are now supporting and saying, he was, you know, a great FBI director, he never did anything wrong. You know, I think that this is the kind of political unintended consequences.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, the Democrats jumped all over him when he did that thing with Clinton. That's right. But nobody said anything bad about him before or since.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Oh, we have on the record, Nancy Pelosi saying things like he better watch his job, we are not sure he's have that job.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: During the Clinton issue.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Yes. Correct. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: The Clinton issue should be dead now. Trump wants to bring it back to have cover-up his --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It would have been jumping up and down, glee and joy if Hillary won, and she would have gotten rid of Comey immediately.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: That's for sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, first off, Bob, I'm not going to call him crying Chuck, I'm going to call him up-Chuck. Because I think it's much more, it's just shorter. Bring up Clinton. Let's talk about the Clinton-Lewinsky scandal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I want to because this is an important point. The Clinton-Lewinsky scandal took an administration's eye off the ball which led indirectly to Islamic terror and 9/11 because they were so consumed by that scandal. So, now you have a media that's suffering from unhinge of mosses (ph). They are unhinged over Russia, preoccupying the administration. So, we may get a 9/12 instead of 9/11.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: The biggest job creation, eight years in the history of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, you missed my point. You weren't even listening.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, that part was probably right.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: That's what happens when you say Monica Lewinsky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, my point is --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Why didn't you mention the blue dress?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The bigger point is that you have an administration that has to obsess over something like over here, you miss the bigger picture. We should be thinking about the bigger picture.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which we missed because Clinton wasn't looking at the big picture, he was looking at something else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And now we are talking about just everything. Yes. The full interview with President Trump is tomorrow at 9:00 p.m. Eastern on "Justice with Judge Jeanine."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We have seen it all.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hay ya-yay. Up next, is there a difference between the mainstream media and the Democratic Party? Answers all. Right ahead. And later, a classic Will Ferrell moment on a college campus. You have got to see this. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Now. We want you all to stay with us. This show has another half hour. It's usually me at the end, the last minute. But I'm actually in the middle of the show today. So, please don't turn off your TV. President Trump's firing of James Comey was by far the biggest story of the week. Here are some of the interesting reactions according to our producers.

utterances.speaker: BOB SCHIEFFER, CBS NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: There are many parallels to Watergate. But I have to tell you. I think all the way back to the Kennedy assassination to draw parallels, I was there as you know.

utterances.speaker: SEN. DICK DURBIN, D-ILLINOIS
utterances.utterance: President Trump is dangerous. Dangerous because he may be obstructing justice in terms of the investigation that really goes to the heart of our democracy.

utterances.speaker: DANA BASH, CNN CHIEF POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: I mean, it almost feels like a scene out of the Godfather. But it's not, it's real. And it's very -- it's alarming.

utterances.speaker: SEN. RON WYDEN, D-OREGON
utterances.utterance: I will also tell you that we asked Clint Watts, the former FBI director about this, he said, you are absolutely right, senator, you ought to be following the money. But you also ought to know that you should follow the trail of the dead bodies.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, God!

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Wow! And it is a Godfather moment. Who shows (INAUDIBLE) in the Trump administration, I'm curios?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. The only scandals with dead bodies recently were Fast and the Furious and Benghazi.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Ahh! Again!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, I didn't see any dead bodies on this Russia deal. And I think the media and the Democrats are colluding more than Trump and Russia according to WikiLeaks. So, I think you guys might want to check that out too. I'm worried about the Democrats--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --and the media.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You're worried about--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --because they're going so in together with each other that the American people are just not going to believe in either polls, in either analysis, in either predictions, because they know they're so in the tank. And if this Russia thing doesn't catch any big fish, what are they going to have to show for it?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Gala (ph) showed that two to one of the American people trusted the media over President Trump, so.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I saw another poll that said it was the opposite.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --or Jesse Watters, Watters' World, whatever it's called.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, thanks for the plug.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No problem, all right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Saturday night.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Now, the serious -- the serious well-informed person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, Greg.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, no. That would be so far over--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You are losing control, Bob.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I was going to say that I think that Dick Durbin goes a little too far, as usual, in his criticism of the president on this -- on this Comey issue. However, he did make one really good point which was, to me, to my liking, he said he's the only person I've seen so far who pointed out the facts that Attorney General, Jeff Sessions recused himself from the Russia investigation, investigation into the Trump Administration ties with Russia which is all as it should be. However, he then comes back and writes this justification memorandum that becomes part of the basis for Comey's firing. So, how is it that he recuses himself from the investigation but has a hand in him being let go?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: --I wanted to say that I think that that is probably why President Trump has gone back on the narrative and said, you know what, I'm the one who made this decision, I made it a long time ago. I was going to go through with it no matter what. I think he was protecting the attorney general.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --let me ask you that question, excuse me, you had your chance, son. You could just--

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They both--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --please, learn manners, will you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, what do you think about this? I mean, there really was -- Sessions didn't recuse himself from the Russians, then why did he get in the middle of this?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why did he?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't really feel that he did. I think it was his deputy AG that issued the memorandum and did that at, you know, the president's request, so I don't see what the problem is. I don't feel that it was an improper recusal to begin with and I think that he stayed within the bounds of it, so I don't see any grounds there for alarm.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Did you ever recuse yourself of any court cases?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No? I bet you did.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I didn't have to.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: OK, now, Greg--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --in all the times you've been in court.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Now, what do you think, I mean seriously, this story about the memorandum being the decision point for the president--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --the fact of the matter is the president invited both of them to the White House and said write me a narrative so I can fire this guy. It didn't come out that way with the White House. They said, no. Of course, it was something he got and then he made the decision.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, first, two points to me--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --and they both have to do with the segment, not that question.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We were talking originally about the collusion between Democrats and media and how -- this is somehow a revelation, it isn't. The media and the Democratic Party are the Beavis and Butthead of leftism and it's tough to be a Republican because it's not one against one, it's always two against one--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --in an election--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who's Beavis and who's Butthead?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --good question--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --it's astonishing that the Republicans--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --dominate when they are outnumbered, but the other thing is the media -- the media should love Trump because you'll learn more about politics. We're talking about recusal. We're talking about all sorts of interesting arcane, you know, a bench you've learned more about politics in a hundred days from Trump in 16 years of Bush and Obama and the ratings for all of you at CNN and MSNBC are buying your second homes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, that's very nice to hear from you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --real Bob.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --I know your--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --I think that's wonderful. All right, we're going to go on now and next on "The Five"--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --a big new antidrug announcement from Attorney General, Jeff Sessions today but critics are already saying it will backfire, which it will. We'll have the debate up ahead. Let me debate before it gets bored.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wanted to do Facebook Friday, but instead let's do a story on drugs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Attorney General--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Thought the same.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --yes, Attorney General, Jeff Sessions announced the Department Of Justice will now pursue the stiffest possible penalties for drug offenders. That overturns the 2013 directive by Obama's Attorney General, Eric Holder, you remember him, who ordered federal prosecutors to avoid charging certain suspects with crimes that carry stiff mandatory minimums. Sessions today, said the new policy was aimed, of course, at reducing crime.

utterances.speaker: JEFF SESSIONS, ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: We are seeing an increase in violent crime in our cities particularly, in Baltimore, Chicago, Memphis and Milwaukee, St. Louis and many others. The murder rate has surged 10 percent nationwide. The largest increase in murders since 1968 and we know that drugs and crime go hand-in-hand. They just do, the facts prove that so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But civil liberties advocates slammed the new policies counterproductive with Mr. Holder going so far as you call it dumb on crime, my word, Gillian. So, they're linking this increased in violent crime to drug trafficking, but we know that when you crack down on drugs, that only -- that doesn't reduce demand, it just creates more crime.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's a tough situation. I think what it boils down to is that the Holder Policy was called smart on crime because at the time he implemented it--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: --the department was spending more than a third of its budget incarcerating people--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: --rather than preventing crimes, investigating crimes, which is what they're supposed to do, so that sounds well and good. But I see the flipside here because there's a major downside. This is like incontrovertible truth which is that when you make it easier for people to get away with selling drugs, drug dealers are going to proliferate on our nation's streets. And so there's obviously a very heavy tension here and that's kind of what -- the Attorney General, Sessions comes down hard on the side of prosecuting drug dealers. I don't know what the answer is, but it's--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know what the answer is, Bob.

utterances.speaker: TURNER
utterances.utterance: Of course, you know the answer--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Prohibition, we learned a lesson, it ruined lives and once we lifted prohibition, people learned to drink responsibly, a lot of people don't but that's what human nature is. We can't control everybody, how can we teach people how to enjoy what Earth offers if we constantly make everything illegal, people have a right -- a right to their own oblivion, and we must allow them to seek it in the safety of their own homes instead of criminalizing them and putting them in prison?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Very well said. Listen, this thing started mostly under Reagan when he had the three strike issue--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --and who got incarcerated? Why did they just made (ph) the drug dealers? It was a lot of people who smoked dope and got caught for the third time and put it in and eventually led to -- then eventually led to the creation of for-profit prisons. Now, you know, the fact of the matter is Sessions, he would have arrested somebody who smoked -- what?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I just wanted to tell you something.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Did you just interrupt me and say you want to tell me something?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: OK, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just want to -- you guys were on TV right now.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: 99 percent of the people under the federal laws are incarcerated are for drug trafficking--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --it's not like Cheech & Chong people?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes, but there's -- they don't have a lot of people who smoke dope and--

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --no? Really?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --quantified sizes of how much drugs, right Kimberly?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, in state if you can get busted for possession, et cetera, but not federal and federal, were these mandatory minimums and these sentencing's are, that's what you are dealing with and who's it's catching.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, let's talk to issue of what you talk about dealing, is it not when the difference between charging someone with crack cocaine and powder cocaine is different?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think they changed that, right?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know whether they did or didn't, but the point is how long are we going to keep doing this and recognize that, you are right, Greg, you're going to have people--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can't.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --you're going to -- look, if you take a drug dealer a big one off the streak, someone else will take his place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And in some -- in some areas of life and I know you'd disagree with me KG, the drug dealer is just no different than a businessman dealing something, I know. But remember, human beings seek a way out of their lives.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That is not -- OK, why don't you ask the people that have been put out of their lives in Chicago and inner cities across it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's because it's illegal.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --from violent crime--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gang crime, right. I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --by drug cartels led by gang members.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hate the cartels.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They're not businessmen, they're murders and they fray on innocent lives.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Legalize it--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: If you legalize marijuana and cocaine, unfortunately it will go to clinics to do it and I was addicted to both of them, I was addicted to you which is amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I got to get Judge Jeanine here before you confess--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen, if he's going to get him locked up, I say let him go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't you remember--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I have been locked up so many times -- what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was going to bring up the story where you forgot where you put a certain stash of something.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --and we'll talk more about that.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: We did that on your show.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I never got more response.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I was on that show.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I put $25,000 and an ounce of cocaine in a security box and I couldn't find it.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean this is my point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to hear more about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No one ever found it?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No. And they tried everybody--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, it's still out there somewhere, everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's the beginning of a reality show, find Bob's stash.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I got to go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: --can use the stash.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I'm out. Let's get out of here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Jesse. My sense with Donald Trump is that he's the kind of person who doesn't want to interfere with American lives. So, I'm surprised that he would go this hard on something like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but on the other hand, he's very antidrug. He's never smoked pot in his life and his brother had a big drug problem.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He doesn't drink.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He does not drink alcohol and he's a law and order guy and a lot of these drug traffickers are involved with MS13--

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, and how about--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --and they ruin children's lives.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, 35,000 Americans died from opioid abuse last year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Alcohol doesn't--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --so did Christy, we saw it when we were in New Hampshire for the convention.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly. So, it's a compassionate move by the president and the attorney general.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I disagree.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You call that a compassionate move?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think it keeps the streets safer and it keeps--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It doesn't. It hasn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It hasn't so far.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's because for the last eight years, they were talking of rehab.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Obama, Obama, Obama.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --of criminals is because they weren't keeping the criminals under gun laws in jail. They were letting them out.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Whose source is easier--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Oh, you are. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Directly ahead, Bob, a major story you won't hear much about in the mainstream media, Christians under attack in the Middle East, we'll be right back with that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wall Street Journal has got a big new report out today about Christians fleeing the Middle East. The reason, they're under attack by extremist groups and little to nothing is being done to protect them. Yesterday Vice-President, Mike Pence acknowledged the magnitudes of the threat Christians are facing all across the region.

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE, VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: Practitioners of terror, harbor a special hatred for the followers of Christ, and none more so than the barbarians known as ISIS. That brutal regime shows the savagery frankly unseen in the Middle East since the middle ages. And I believe ISIS is guilty of nothing short of genocide against people of the Christian faith. And it is time the world called it by name.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, it is true that more Arab Christians are living outside the region today than inside the region. There is something like 20 million Arab Christians living abroad and 15 million living inside the region. So, it's obvious to me the demographics are changing. What do you think, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, then the last administration focused heavily on Islamophobia and I believe this administration is now focusing on Christian genocide. I think we should focus on all victims no matter what their religion is. I know the last administration didn't want to discuss the religious nature of the enemy and I think it's good for this administration to discuss that motivation behind the savage attack is based on religion. Because when you talk about the truth and accept the reality on the ground, I think you can actually make smarter decisions. So, I'm glad they're--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know, it's Groundhog Day again, but--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, you're wrong again.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: --the fact is that the captive Christians have been in that region longer than Muslims have been there and the fact that they have been killed, we talked about this for years, it's one of these that drives me absolutely crazy, the Egyptians tried for a while to protect, but then they backed off and they didn't do the job they said they were going to do. The rest of that region do nothing because they want to see genocide. They want Christians out of there and if these Muslim leaders who are supposedly our friends would stand up and say something, but you're cowards. You know, Saudi Arabia, I mean what's wrong with you, you fund terrorism, you sell us your oil, and then you won't say a thing about this. Come on, you can do better than that. You got a lot of princess with a lot of money and nothing to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean at the same time, though Kimberly, I mean you talk about--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: --you talk about radical ideology all the time--

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: they're not exclusively targeting Christians, right? These crazy people who practice perverted versions of Islam will happily kill Jews, Christians, Hindus. They hate nonbelievers, you know, it's not only Christians, right?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, no. I mean it's pure evil and in terms of their radical jihad--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --they're merciless and they don't let anybody stand in their way. But I do think it's important to highlight what's happening to Christians and the genocide--

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: --that is occurring in, you know, in Pakistan. You have that Christian girls that are kidnapped, worse to convert to Islam, married to Muslim men, and it's just horrible to think that we're seeing happening, you know, across the word. And it's sad because I don't see it being discussed or talked about, you know, enough. So I applaud the vice president for bringing this up.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Who's left?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You get the last word if you--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I'd rather just talk about how the media portrays this and what they focus on. It broadened the scope of the victims that they are acceptable victims in the media and they're unacceptable villains. So, we will have countless stories that turn out to be hoaxes that generate the scare of Islamophobia. We are constantly told that we are in Islamophobic nature, a nation based on these rampage hoaxes and they turn out to be faked. So, the media focuses on that and ignores the real suffering that's happening worldwide that in which the victims are Christian, Muslim, women and gays. They die daily. But, you know, someone writes something derogatory on a wall in a campus, that's where the news goes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Stick with us. "One More Thing" is coming up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing", I'll go first. So--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --Will Ferrell, Comedian give the commencement address at USC where he went to school. Here's a little sneak peak.

utterances.speaker: WILL FERRELL, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: This is not my first commencement speech. The institutions, to which I have spoken at previously include, Bryman School of Nursing, Hollywood DJ Academy--

utterances.speaker: FERRELL
utterances.utterance: --and Trump University.

utterances.speaker: FERRELL
utterances.utterance: And I will always love you, you--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg didn't even laugh at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know I've been there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And also don't forget to catch my show, Watters' World, 8:00 this Saturday Night. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, and after Jessie, 10:00, Saturday, my show I got Amanda Head, David Angelo, Katherine Timpf, and Tyrus. It's going to be a wild, wild show, but now it's time for this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Greg's Fashion News.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. That's fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Number out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, is that a sole.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, I want to thank Leanne Johnson Green (ph) gave me this--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, move it like that -- move it like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't that amazing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No this way, wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Does she have a website--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Unicorn--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --well, I think she's found them when she purchased them. These are -- these are unicorn high-tops.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How did she know your size?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Did you get those out of Manhattan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, KG.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, that was so weird.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, so--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that was fast.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, here's the story where we would commend first responders for the work they do and put it on the line every day, some of you may have seen or heard about this story. Take a look at this dramatic rescue video from yesterday showing the moment when heroic first responders in Southern California saved the life of a woman who had threatened to jump from the roof of a 22-storey building.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There you go, woo, yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK, well obviously very excited to save the live. The woman was eventually brought down from the building safely. God Bless You, first responders, always shows up and save the day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Bob.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I want to wish everybody a Happy Mother's Day, but I was married for a very brief period of time and my wife divorced me when my children were younger. We stock together and raised the kids to with a lot of people and I want to commend her, her name is Leland Keyser and she did a terrific job with the kids. We worked together well and we kept them and the first in our thoughts. And I suggest anybody who's -- it's never good to be divorced for kids, but I think it's a -- it's something that you can do and you can do well.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, on to Robert Mugabe, a Zimbabwean. I'm a little more focused on Africa than others because half of my family lives there. He's been caught recently snoozing away at eight different international summits, a lot of criticism. His spokesperson issued a statement today saying he's not sleeping, he's protecting his eyes, so I thought I would bring that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I believe him. All right, that's it for us. Mother's Day, Happy Mother's Day to everybody. Have a great weekend. Hannity is next.
